Text: The drone hub extender is not connected to an uplink
Translation: 无人机中心扩展未连接到上行线路

Text: The uplink is out of range
Resources delivered at the Elevator are instantly transported to the other side.<newline>
Translation: 运送到电梯的资源都会被瞬间传送到另一端。<newline>
Old Text: Resources delivered at the Elevator and anything available are instantly transported to the other side.<newline>
Old Translation: 运送到电梯的资源以及其他可用的物品都会被瞬间传送到另一端。<newline>

Text: Resources delivered at the other side of Elevator and anything available are instantly transported to this side.<newline>
Translation: 运送到电梯另一端的资源以及其他可用的物品都会被瞬间传送到这一端。<newline>

Text: <red>Below minimum</red> : The minimum for the <location> is higher than the requested amount. Not everything will be transported.<newline>
Translation: <red>低于下限</red>：<location>的下限高于所请求的数量。只会运送其中一部分。<newline>

Text: <red>Not enough</red> : More is required to fulfil the request.<newline>
Translation: <red>不足</red>：需要更多才能满足请求。<newline>

Text: <yellow>Limited</yellow> : There is enough for this Elevator but not for all active requests on the <location>.<newline>
Translation: <yellow>受限</yellow>：已满足这部电梯的请求，但尚未满足<location>上的所有当前请求。<newline>

Text: Cannot provide the minimum requested amount
Translation: 无法提供最低所需数量
Old Text: Rocket is waiting for maintenance
Old Translation: 火箭正在等待维护

Text: Carries supplies and vehicles from Mars.
Translation: 从火星上运载物资和载具。

Old Text: Requested cargo<right><current>/<capacity>
Old Translation: 已请求货物<right><current>/<capacity>

Text: <red>Not enough</red> : more is required to depart.<newline>
Old Text: <red>Not enough</red> means more are required to depart.<newline>
Old Translation: <red>不足</red>代表需要更多才能离开。<newline>

Text: <yellow>Limited</yellow> : there is enough for this Asteroid Lander but not for all active requests on this map.<newline>
Translation: <yellow>受限</yellow>：已满足此小行星登陆舱的请求，但尚未满足这张地图上的所有当前请求。<newline>
Old Text: <yellow>Limited</yellow> means there are enough for this payload request but not for all active requests on this map.<newline>
Old Translation: <yellow>受限</yellow>代表可以满足此处的货物请求，但不满足这张地图上所有的请求。<newline>

Translation: <green>准备就绪</green>：已经足够，可以离开。<newline>
Old Text: <green>Ready</green> means there are enough to depart.<newline>
Old Translation: <green>准备就绪</green>代表离开的数量足够。<newline>

Text: <red>Habitat is full. No births can take place.</red>
Current status: Births are forbidden (Habitat is full)
Translation: 当前状态：禁止生育（居住地已满）
建筑发现地点数量已最大

Old Text: Cave In
Old Translation: 塌方

Text: Rubble that collapsed down from the ceiling. This is must be the result from an earlier Underground Marsquake.
Translation: 从顶部落下的碎石。这一定是之前的地下地震造成的。
Old Text: Rubble that collapsed down from the ceiling. This indicates the area is unstable. It is too dangerous to clear this before we know more about the Martian Underground.
Old Translation: 从顶部落下的碎石。这表明该区域不稳定。为我们得进一步了解火星的地下才能安全地清理塌方。

Old Text: Clear Cave-In
Old Translation: 清理塌方

Text: An underground deposit of Exotic Minerals. Can be exploited by a Exotic Minerals Extractor staffed by Colonists.
Translation: 位于地下的奇异矿物资源点。可以让殖民地居民操作奇异矿物挖掘站进行开采。

Text: Deep underground deposit of Exotic Minerals. Can be exploited by a Exotic Minerals Extractor staffed by Colonists.
Translation: 位于地下深处的奇异矿物资源点。可以让殖民地居民操作奇异矿物挖掘站进行开采。

Text: Scattered Exotic Minerals. Harvested by Drones or RC Transports.
Translation: 零散的奇异矿物。由无人机或遥控运输车开采而得。

Text: Scattered Rare Metals. Harvested by Drones or RC Transports.
Translation: 零散的稀有金属。由无人机或遥控运输车开采而得。

Text: Loose rubble is blocking this entire section. It must be a bit unstable, and would be too dangerous to clear before we know more about the Martian Underground.
Translation: 松散的碎石完全挡住了这片区域。结构不稳，存在二次坍塌的危险，我们得进一步了解火星的地下才能安全地清理塌方。
<green>鼹鼠人喜欢在地下活动！+<morale_boost> （士气）</green>

Text: Exotic Minerals can only be found on Asteroids.
Translation: 奇异矿物只能从小行星上发现。

Text: The Surface of Mars and the main location of our colonization efforts.
Translation: 火星地表和我们殖民行动的主要位置。

Text: The world below the Martian surface. Dark tunnels and caves hide a wealth of resources that could help us establish a successful colony on the red planet.
Translation: 火星地表下的世界。黑暗的隧道和洞穴中藏有丰富的资源，可以助我们在这个红色星球上建立一处兴旺的殖民地。

Old Text: ( remaining)
Old Translation: （剩余）

Text: Are you sure you want to abandon this Asteroid?
Translation: 是否确定要废弃该小行星？

Text: Detailed Scan (Costs: <resource(amount, resource)> stored in Recon Centers)
Translation: 详细扫描（花费：侦查中心里的<resource(amount, resource)>）

Text: The price of the Asteroid Lander
Number of Sols before popup shows that Asteroid will go out of range
Translation: 在弹出窗口显示小行星将超出范围之前的太阳日

Text: Ensures a minimum discovery rate, regardless of the amount of recon centers or their performance.
Translation: 保障发现机率下限，使其不受侦察中心与工作效率的影响。

Text: Amount of drones that work per resource request
Translation: 每个资源作业所需的无人机数量
货物所需的无人机数量

Text: Amount of maintenance points a cave-in adds to buildings
Translation: 塌方给建筑物增加的维护点数

Text: Amount of maintenance points a cave-in adds to buildings
Translation: 塌方给建筑物增加的维护点数

Text: Morale Boost given by the Crystal Statue
Translation: 水晶雕像提供的士气加成

Text: Minimum + random = hours until next Underground Marsquake
Translation: 最小+随机=距下一次地下地震的时间

Text: Random extra hours before the next underground Marsquake
Translation: 距离下次地下地震的随机额外小时数

Text: Minimum + random = hours until next Underground Marsquake
Translation: 最小+随机=距下一次地下地震的时间

Text: Minimum time in hours before the next underground Marsquake
Translation: 距离下次地下地震的最小小时数

Text: Time it takes for a Rocket to travel from Mars to Asteroid
Translation: 火箭从火星到小行星所花的时间
火箭飞行时间（火星至小行星）

Text: Colonist Sanity decreases when a Colonist is living Underground
Translation: 当有殖民地居民生活在地下时，殖民地居民理智度下降

Text: Colonist Morale decreases when a Colonist is living Underground
Translation: 当有殖民地居民生活在地下时，殖民地居民士气下降

Text: Had a single Asteroid Lander visit 10 asteroids before returning to Mars
Translation: 单个小行星登陆舱在返回火星之前，已造访10颗小行星
Old Text: Have a single Asteroid Lander visit 10 asteroids before returning to Mars

Text: Have a single Asteroid Lander visit 10 asteroids before returning to Mars
Translation: 单个小行星登陆舱在返回火星之前，造访10颗小行星

Text: Went game over as your last colonists left Mars behind to take a trip into the great unknown
Translation: 已因你的最后一名殖民地居民离开火星去未知世界旅行而游戏结束

Text: Go game over as your last colonists leaves Mars behind to take a trip into the great unknown
Translation: 因你的最后一名殖民地居民离开火星去未知世界旅行而游戏结束

Text: Fully developed all buried wonders in the underground, before sol 100
Translation: 已在100个太阳日内，完全发掘地下所有埋藏的奇观

Text: Fully develop all buried wonders in the underground, before sol 100
Translation: 在100个太阳日内，完全发掘地下所有埋藏的奇观

Text: Fully developed a buried wonder to benefit your colony
Translation: 已完全发掘一处埋藏的奇观，使你的殖民地受益

Text: Fully develop a buried wonder to benefit your colony
Translation: 完全发掘一处埋藏的奇观，使你的殖民地受益

Text: Retrieved all resources from an asteroid & leave nothing behind
Translation: 已从一颗小行星上带回所有资源，而且什么都没落下

Text: Retrieve all resources from an asteroid & leave nothing behind
Translation: 从一颗小行星上带回所有资源，而且什么都没落下

Text: All your colonists live underground (at least 200 colonists)
Translation: 你所有的殖民地居民都住在地下（最少200名居民）

Text: All your colonists live underground (at least 200 colonists)
Translation: 你所有的殖民地居民都住在地下（最少200名居民）

Text: Completed all techs in the recon & expansion tech tree
Translation: 已研发完侦察和扩张科技树上的所有技术

Text: Complete all techs in the recon & expansion tech tree
Translation: 研发完侦察和扩张科技树上的所有技术
已阻止地下地震导致的100次塌方
Old Text: Prevented all cave-ins during a marsquake
Old Translation: 已在地震时，预防一切塌方

Text: Prevent 100 Cave-ins in total from Underground Marsquakes
Translation: 阻止地下地震导致的100次塌方
Old Text: Prevent all cave-ins during a marsquake
Old Translation: 在地震时，预防一切塌方

Text: +<upgrade1_mul_value_1>% Production as long as the building is supplied with Fuel. If not supplied with Fuel, the building will continue to operate but will lose the bonus.
Translation: 在建筑配备燃料的情况下，+<upgrade1_mul_value_1>%产量。若未配备燃料，虽然建筑会继续运转，但不会获得加成效果。

Text: +<upgrade1_mul_value_1>% Production as long as the building is supplied with Fuel. If not supplied with Fuel, the building will continue to operate but will lose the bonus.
Translation: 在建筑配备燃料的情况下，+<upgrade1_mul_value_1>%产量。若未配备燃料，虽然建筑会继续运转，但不会获得加成效果。

Text: The Micro-G Habitat requires Oxygen and Water in order to sustain colonists. It has an endless supply of synthesized rations but supplying the building with Food will improve the Health, Sanity and Comfort of the residents.
Translation: 微重力居住地需要氧气和水来维持殖民地居民的生存。它有无限的合成口粮供应，但为该建筑提供食物将改善居民的生命值、理智度和舒适度。

Text: Replicas of the Cave of Wonders' crystals, but just as enticing and exhilarating. It improves the Morale for all residence in the same dome.
Translation: 奇观洞穴里水晶的复制品，但和真的水晶一样诱人且振奋人心。能提升同座穹顶中所有住宅的士气

Text: Stores <preciousminerals(max_storage_per_resource)>. Some resources will be transported to other depots within Drone range.
Translation: 可以储存<preciousminerals(max_storage_per_resource)>。部分资源将会被运输至无人机范围内的其它仓库中。

Text: A small reinforced Dome that is only suitable for subsurface environments.
Translation: 一种小型加固穹顶，只适合地下环境。

Text: A large reinforced Dome that is only suitable for subsurface environments.
Translation: 一种大型加固穹顶，只适合地下环境。

Text: The most economical Dome designed specifically for subsurface environments. It provides extremely limited habitable space and has no capacity to host a Spire.
Translation: 专为地下环境设计的最经济的穹顶。它提供的居住空间极其有限，而且无法容纳尖塔。

Old Text: +<upgrade1_add_value_1> Recon per Sol; +<power(upgrade1_mul_value_2)> Consumption.
Old Translation: 每个太阳日+<upgrade1_add_value_1>侦察；+<power(upgrade1_mul_value_2)>耗费。

Text: Generates Recon which leads to detection of Asteroids we can visit and various smaller discoveries.
Translation: 产生侦察，可用于探测到我们可以访问的小行星，以及各种小型发现。

Text: When enough Recon is accumulated a discovery is be made. This can be a minor discovery, an event discovery or an Asteroids discovery. Asteroids can be researched further to get more information on the available resources on them. In order to do so sufficient Electronics need to be stored at the Recon Center at the time of the discovery. Multiple Recon Centers work towards the same discovery and increase the Recon accumulated. The amount of extra Recon generated declines with each new Recon Center that is constructed.
Translation: 当积累到足够多的侦察时，就会做出一项发现。可能是小发现、事件发现或是小行星发现。可以对小行星进行进一步的研究，以获得其上可用资源的更多信息。为达成这一点，需要在发现时将足够的电子元件储存在侦察中心。 多个侦察中心用于同一发现，可增加侦察积累量。每座新造的侦察中心产生的额外侦察量递减。
Old Text: When enough Recon is accumulated a discovery is be made. This can be a minor discovery, an event discovery or an Asteroids discovery. Asteroids can be researched further to get more information on the available resources on them. In order to do so sufficient Electronics need to be stored at the Recon Center at the time of the discovery. Multiple Recon Centers work towards the same discovery and increase the Recon accumulated. The amount of extra Recon generated declines with each new Recon Center that is constructed.
Old Translation: 当积累到足够多的侦察时，就会做出一项发现。可能是小发现、事件发现或是小行星发现。可以对小行星进行进一步的研究，以获得其上可用资源的更多信息。为达成这一点，需要在发现时将足够的电子元件储存在侦察中心。 多个侦察中心用于同一发现，可增加侦察积累量。每座新造的侦察中心产生的额外侦察量递减。

Text: We don't fully understand how this ancient structure works, but it shows potential for being useful to our colony.
Translation: 我们并不完全了解这件远古建筑的工作原理，但它似乎能为我们的殖民地所用。

Text: A giant hole of indeterminate depth.
A spacious cave filled with massive mysterious crystals. Many colonists seem eager to visit the site.
Translation: 这个宽敞的洞穴里到处都是巨大的神秘水晶。不少殖民地居民看样子都很想去那里一探究竟。
Old Text: Cave of Wonders description.
Old Translation: 奇观洞穴描述。

Text: A cave larger than anything we've encountered in the Martian underground.
Translation: 一个洞穴，比我们在火星地底遇到的任何东西都要大。

Old Text: Surface Passage
Old Translation: 地表通道

Old Text: Surface Passages
Old Translation: 地表通道

Text: A potential connection to the Martian Surface. It is the perfect location to construct an Elevator to the surface.
Translation: 一处潜在的通往火星地表的通路。是建造通往地表的电梯的绝佳地点。
Old Text: A potential entry point into the Martian Underground. It is the perfect foundation for an Elevator.
Old Translation: 一处潜在的进入火星地底的入口。它作为电梯的基础再合适不过了。

Old Text: Underground Passage
Old Translation: 地下通道

Old Text: Underground Passages
Old Translation: 地下通道

Text: A potential entry point into the Martian Underground. It is the perfect foundation for an Elevator to the Underground.
Translation: 一处潜在的进入火星地底的入口。是通往地下的电梯的绝佳基础。
Old Text: A potential connection to the Martian Surface. It is the perfect foundation for an Elevator.
Old Translation: 一处潜在的通往火星地表的通路。它作为电梯的基础再合适不过了。

Text: Transports vehicles, colonists and resources between the surface and the underground of Mars.
Translation: 在火星表面和地下往返运送载具、殖民地居民和资源。
Old Text: Can transport vehicles, colonists and resources between the surface and the underground of Mars.
Old Translation: 可以在火星表面和地下往返运送载具、殖民地居民和资源。

Text: The Elevator can only be built on top off Underground Passages on the surface of Mars or on top off Surface Passages in the Martian underground. The Elevator can be powered and maintained from either side. Resources can be moved from one map to the other by using the Edit Payload action. Once a request for resources has been made it can be changed by using the Edit Payload action again and adjusting the resource amounts.
Translation: 电梯只能建在火星地表的地下通道顶部，或是火星地下的地表通道顶部。电梯可以从两侧供电和维护。 可以用编辑货物操作将资源从一张地图运往另一张地图。一旦提出了资源请求，就可以通过使用编辑货物操作修改并调整资源数量。

Text: Must be constructed over an Underground Entrance or Surface Tunnel.
Translation: 必须建在地下入口或地表隧道上方。
Old Text: Must be constructed over an underground or surface passage.
Old Translation: 必须建在地下或地表通道上。

Text: Must be built on an Underground Entrance or Surface Tunnel
Translation: 必须建在地下入口或地表隧道上。
Old Text: Must be built on an underground or surface passage
Old Translation: 必须建在地下或地表通道上。

Text: +<upgrade1_add_value_1>kg Cargo Capacity; +<upgrade1_add_value_2> Fuel required to launch.
Translation: + <upgrade1_add_value_1>千克货舱容量；+ <upgrade1_add_value_2>发射所需燃料。
Old Text: +<upgrade1_add_value_1>kg Cargo Capacity; + <fuel(upgrade1_add_value_2)> required to launch.
Old Translation: + <upgrade1_add_value_1>千克货舱容量；+ <fuel(upgrade1_add_value_2)>启动需求。

Text: Rockets that can transport resources and colonists between Mars and Asteroids.
Translation: 可以在火星和小行星之间运送资源和殖民地居民的火箭。

Text: Rockets that can transport resources and colonists between Mars and Asteroids.
Translation: 可以在火星和小行星之间运送资源和殖民地居民的火箭。

Text: Reduces the risk of cave-ins in a small area.
Translation: 降低小块区域内塌方的风险。

Text: Marks a surface to be cleared from waste rock by Drones. Rocks are turned into Waste Rock.
Translation: 标记一处需要无人机清理矿渣的表面。岩石会被转化为矿渣。

Text: Stores <preciousminerals(UIMaxStorageAmount)>. Some resources will be transported to other depots within Drone range.
Translation: 可以储存<preciousminerals(UIMaxStorageAmount)>。部分资源将会被运输至无人机范围内的其它仓库中。

Text: Self-sufficient lights that pierce even the deepest darkness.
Translation: 自给自足的光线甚至可以穿透最深层的黑暗。

Text: Connects the Ancient Artifact to our main system to allow us to access as much of its protocols as we can.
Translation: 将远古种族制品与我们的主系统相连，我们就能尽可能多地访问其协议了。

Text: A stroke of brilliance, it translates the signals from the Ancient Artifact. Allows us to use the Ancient Artifact as a drone controller that can reach the entire underground. Somehow connected drones also no longer require recharging.
Translation: 灵光一现，它能破译远古种族制品的信号。我们可以把这个远古种族制品用作无人机控制器，从而到达地下的全部区域。不知为何，与之相连的无人机也不再需要充电了。

Text: Must be constructed over an Ancient Artifact.
Translation: 必须建造在远古种族制品上面。

Text: Must be built over an Ancient Artifact
Translation: 必须建造在远古种族制品上面。

Text: Unlocks <upgrade1_add_value_1> new Breakthrough techs<newline><newline>Each experiment can only be done once, repeating this upgrade on a new Bottemless Pit Lab gives nothing.
Translation: 解锁<upgrade1_add_value_1>项新突破性技术<newline><newline>每种实验只能进行一次。在新无底深坑实验室反复进行此项升级不提供任何收益。

Text: Unlocks <upgrade2_add_value_1> new Breakthrough techs<newline><newline>Each experiment can only be done once, repeating this upgrade on a new Bottemless Pit Lab gives nothing.
Translation: 解锁<upgrade2_add_value_1>项新突破性技术<newline><newline>每种实验只能进行一次。在新无底深坑实验室反复进行此项升级不提供任何收益。

Text: Unlocks <upgrade3_add_value_1> new Breakthrough techs<newline><newline>Each experiment can only be done once, repeating this upgrade on a new Bottemless Pit Lab gives nothing.
Translation: 解锁<upgrade3_add_value_1>项新突破性技术<newline><newline>每种实验只能进行一次。在新无底深坑实验室反复进行此项升级不提供任何收益。

Text: A building dedicated to researching the "bottomless" pit. Consumes resources to generate Research.
Translation: 一座专用于研究“无底”深坑的建筑。消耗资源，产生研究点数。

Text: Must be constructed over a Bottomless Pit.
Translation: 必须建造在无底深坑上。

Text: Must be built on a Bottomless Pit
Translation: 必须建造在无底深坑上。

Text: This reinforcement is designed to sure up the structural instabilities of the Jumbo Cave.
Translation: 这种加固是为了降低巨型洞穴的结构不稳定性。

Text: Must be constructed in a Jumbo Cave.
Translation: 必须建造在巨型洞穴内部。

Text: Must be built in a Jumbo Cave
Translation: 必须建造在巨型洞穴内部。

Text: A fully automated facility that extracts any type of resource from within Asteroids. It extracts from one deposit at a time and moves on to the next one in range when it depletes a deposit.<newline><newline>All extractors raise dust resulting in more frequent maintenance for buildings in the grey area.
Translation: 从小行星内部开采任意类型资源的全自动设备。一次只能开采一处资源点，资源点耗尽后，会继续开采范围内下一处资源点。<newline><newline>所有的挖掘站都会扬起尘土，导致灰色区域内的建筑需要更频繁地维护。

Text: A fully automated facility that extracts water from within Asteroids.<newline><newline>All extractors raise dust resulting in more frequent maintenance for buildings in the grey area.
Translation: 从小行星内部开采水资源的全自动设备。<newline><newline>所有的挖掘站都会扬起尘土，导致灰色区域内的建筑需要更频繁地维护。

Text: Boosts the range of a single Drone Hub or Drone Hub Extender allowing drones to work a larger area.
Translation: 提升单个无人机中心或无人机中心扩展的范围，允许无人机在更广的区域内工作。

Text: Extracts any type of resource from within Asteroids. It extracts from one deposit at a time and moves on to the next one in range when it depletes a deposit.<newline><newline>All extractors raise dust resulting in more frequent maintenance for buildings in the grey area.
Translation: 从小行星内部开采任意类型资源的设备。一次只能开采一处资源点，资源点耗尽后，会继续开采范围内下一处资源点。<newline><newline>所有的挖掘站都会扬起尘土，导致灰色区域内的建筑需要更频繁地维护。

Text: Living space for colonists on asteroids. Does not require a dome.
Translation: 小行星上殖民地居民的生活空间。不需要穹顶。

Text: - Asteroid Lander resupply cost reduced by 50% - 1 Free Asteroid Lander - Bonus Prefabs: 2x Recon Centers - Bonus Tech: Micro-G Mining (Unlocks the Micro-G Auto and Water Extractors)
Translation: - 小行星登陆舱重新补给花费降低50% - 1个免费小行星登陆舱 - 额外预制件：2x 侦察中心 - 加成技术：微重力采矿 （解锁微重力自动挖掘站和水资源挖掘站）
Old Text: - Asteroid Lander cost reduced by 50% - Bonus Prefabs: 2x Recon Centers - Bonus Tech: Micro-G Mining (Unlocks the Micro-G Auto and Water Extractors)
Old Translation: - 小行星登陆舱价格降低50% - 额外预制件：2x 侦察中心 - 加成技术：微重力采矿 （解锁微重力自动挖掘站和水资源挖掘站）

Text: - Colonists regain Sanity while in the Underground instead of losing Sanity - Bonus Prefabs: 1x Elevator; 2x Drone Hub Extenders - Bonus Tech: Underground Domes (Unlocks the Underground Basic and Micro Domes)
Translation: - 殖民地居民在地下时恢复且不再损失理智度 - 额外预制件：1x电梯；2x无人机中心扩展 - 加成技术：地下穹顶（解锁地下基础穹顶和微型穹顶）

Text: B-Type Asteroids are known for their high quantity of Polymers. They usually also contain Exotic Minerals and Rare Metals. This type of Asteroid does not always contain Water
Translation: B型小行星因其大量的聚合物而知名。它们通常还含有奇异矿物和稀有金属。此类小行星并不一定含有水资源。
Old Text: These B-Type Asteroids are known for their high quantity of Polymers. While they have a decent amount of Water and Exotic Minerals they only contain a small amount of Rare Metals.
Old Translation: 这些B型小行星因其大量的聚合物而知名。它们虽储有可观数量的水资源和奇异矿物，但只有很少量的稀有金属。

Text: B-Type Asteroids are known for their high quantity of Polymers. They usually also contain Exotic Minerals and Rare Metals. This type of Asteroid does not always contain Water. Our sensors are also picking up something else that we can't make sense of yet...
Translation: B型小行星因其大量的聚合物而知名。它们通常还含有奇异矿物和稀有金属。此类小行星并不一定含有水资源。 我们的传感器还检测到一些我们暂时无法理解的东西……
Old Text: B-Type Asteroids are known for their high quantity of Polymers. They usually also contain Exotic Minerals and Rare Metals. This type of Asteroid does not always contain Water. Our sensors are also picking up something else that we can't make sense of yet...
Old Translation: B型小行星因其大量的聚合物而知名。它们通常还含有奇异矿物和稀有金属。此类小行星并不一定含有水资源。 我们的传感器还检测到一些我们暂时无法理解的东西……

Text: C-Type Asteroids are the most common of all. They mostly contain Exotic Minerals, Rare Metals, Water and sometimes Polymers.
Translation: C型小行星最为常见。它们大多含有奇异矿物、稀有金属、水资源，有时还含有聚合物。
Old Text: This C-Type Asteroid is the most common type of all. It contains some Water and Polymers and has a decent amount of usable Exotic Minerals and Rare Metals.
Old Translation: 这颗C型小行星是最常见的小行星类型。它含有一定水资源和聚合物，且有数量可观的可用奇异矿物和稀有金属。

Text: C-Type Asteroids are the most common of all. They mostly contain Exotic Minerals, Rare Metals, Water and sometimes Polymers. It is worth noting that our scans show some irregularities on this one...
Translation: C型小行星最为常见。它们大多含有奇异矿物、稀有金属、水资源，有时还含有聚合物。 值得注意的是，我们的扫描发现了一些不同寻常的东西……
Old Text: C-Type Asteroids are the most common of all. They mostly contain Exotic Minerals, Rare Metals, Water and sometimes Polymers. It is worth noting that our scans show some irregularities on this one...
Old Translation: C型小行星最为常见。它们大多含有奇异矿物、稀有金属、水资源，有时还含有聚合物。 值得注意的是，我们的扫描发现了一些不同寻常的东西……

Text: D-Type Asteroids are rare and rich in Exotic Minerals and Water but apart from a few Metals contain no other usable resources.
Translation: D型小行星富含奇异矿物和水资源，但除了少量金属以外没有其他可用资源。

Text: D-Type Asteroids are rare and rich in Exotic Minerals and Water but apart from a few Metals contain no other usable resources. Our scientists also point out some odd readings for this particular Asteroid that don't match with the data we have on this Asteroid type...
Translation: D型小行星富含奇异矿物和水资源，但除了少量金属以外没有其他可用资源。 我们的科学家还指出，这颗小行星的某些奇怪读数和我们掌握的这种小行星数据不符……
Old Text: D-Type Asteroids are rare and rich in Exotic Minerals and Water but apart from a few Metals contain no other usable resources. Our scientists also point out some odd readings for this particular Asteroid that don't match with the data we have on this Asteroid type...
Old Translation: D型小行星十分罕见，富含奇异矿物和水资源，但除了少量金属以外没有其他可用资源。 我们的科学家还指出，这颗小行星的某些奇怪读数和我们掌握的这种小行星数据不符……

Text: M-Type Asteroids are predominantly made up from Metals and Rare Metals, but are also known to contain Polymers and Water.
Translation: M型小行星主要由金属和稀有金属。我们还知道它们也含有聚合物和水。
Old Text: M-Type Asteroids are predominantly made up from Metals. They are known to also contain decent amounts of Rare Metals and Polymers but only small amounts of Water.
Old Translation: M型小行星主要由金属组成。众所周知，它们也储有数量丰富的稀有金属和聚合物，但只有少量的水资源。

Text: M-Type Asteroids are predominantly made up from Metals and Rare Metals, but are also known to contain Polymers and Water. We have also been urged to report that there are some strange readings coming from this particular Asteroid...
Translation: M型小行星主要由金属和稀有金属。我们还知道它们也含有聚合物和水。 还有一个必须报告的情况，就是这颗小行星的某些读数很奇怪……
Old Text: M-Type Asteroids are predominantly made up from Metals and Rare Metals, but are also known to contain Polymers and Water. We have also been urged to report that there are some strange readings coming from this particular Asteroid...

Text: P-Type Asteroids are rare and contain an abundance of Rare Metals and Water. While these don't contain any Exotic Minerals, they usually have some usable Polymers and Metals.
Translation: P型小行星非常罕见，储有大量的稀有金属和水资源。它虽然没有奇异矿物，但通常含有一定量可用的聚合物以及金属。
Old Text: P-Type Asteroids are rare and contain an abundance of Rare Metals and Water. While it does not contain any Exotic Minerals it does contain decent amounts of usable Polymers and Metals.
Old Translation: P型小行星非常罕见，储有大量的稀有金属和水资源。它虽然没有奇异矿物，但储有数量可观的可用聚合物和金属。

Text: P-Type Asteroids are rare and contain an abundance of Rare Metals and Water. While these don't contain any Exotic Minerals, they usually have some usable Polymers and Metals. It is also worth noting that there are some irregularities in our scans...
Translation: P型小行星非常罕见，储有大量的稀有金属和水资源。它虽然没有奇异矿物，但通常含有一定量可用的聚合物以及金属。 值得注意的是，我们的扫描发现了一些不同寻常的东西……
Old Text: P-Type Asteroids are rare and contain an abundance of Rare Metals and Water. While these don't contain any Exotic Minerals, they usually have some usable Polymers and Metals. It is also worth noting that there are some irregularities in our scans...
Old Translation: P型小行星非常罕见，储有大量的稀有金属和水资源。它虽然没有奇异矿物，但通常含有一定量可用的聚合物以及金属。 值得注意的是，我们的扫描发现了一些不同寻常的东西……

Text: S-Type Asteroids are the second most common type, and mostly composed of Exotic Minerals and Metals. Keep in mind these never contain Water.
Translation: S型小行星的常见程度仅次于C型，大多由奇异矿物和金属组成。记住，这类小行星上没有水资源。
Old Text: S-Type Asteroids are made up from a large amount of Exotic Minerals. Its composition also contains a decent amount of Metals and small concentrations of Water and Polymers.
Old Translation: S型小行星由大量奇异矿物组成。它的组成成分中还有可观数量的金属，以及少量的水资源和聚合物。

Text: S-Type Asteroids are the second most common type, and mostly composed of Exotic Minerals and Metals. Keep in mind these never contain Water. It was pure luck that we detected this Asteroid at all, something about it is interfering with our scanning equipment causing us to almost miss it...
Translation: S型小行星的常见程度仅次于C型，大多由奇异矿物和金属组成。记住，这类小行星上没有水资源。 我们探测到这颗小行星纯属撞大运。它正在以某种方式干扰我们的扫描设备，导致我们差点没发现它……
Old Text: S-Type Asteroids are the second most common type, and mostly composed of Exotic Minerals and Metals. Keep in mind these never contain Water. It was pure luck that we detected this Asteroid at all, something about it is interfering with our scanning equipment causing us to almost miss it...
Old Translation: S型小行星的常见程度仅次于C型，大多由奇异矿物和金属组成。记住，这类小行星上没有水资源。 我们探测到这颗小行星纯属撞大运。它正在以某种方式干扰我们的扫描设备，导致我们差点没发现它……

Text: We have no record of this Asteroid type. While the gap in our knowledge is unnerving, our scans reveal this Asteroid to be a treasure trove of usable resources...
Translation: 我们没有这类小行星的记录。我们知识的空白令人不安，但我们的扫描显示这颗小行星是可用资源的宝库……

Text: We managed to take new pictures of distant galaxies hidden behind molecular clouds.
Translation: 我们设法拍摄到隐藏在分子云后遥远星系的新照片。

Old Text: Minor discovery
Old Translation: 小发现

Text: We have gathered new data that improves our understanding of Gamma Ray Bursts.
Translation: 我们收集了新的数据，增进了我们对伽玛射线爆发的理解。

Old Text: Minor discovery
Old Translation: 小发现

Text: We have discovered a new Exoplanet that is outside of the Goldilocks zone.
Translation: 我们发现了宜居带之外一颗新的系外行星。

Old Text: Minor discovery
Old Translation: 小发现

Text: We've taken a better look at several known galaxies, confirming earlier models.
Translation: 我们对几个已知星系进行了进一步的观察，证实了之前的模型。

Old Text: Minor discovery
Old Translation: 小发现

Text: An interstellar asteroid will pass by just out of reach.
Translation: 一颗星际小行星将从我们刚好无法到达的地方经过。

Old Text: Minor discovery
Old Translation: 小发现

Text: We are successfully tracking several more Asteroids from the Oort cloud.
Translation: 我们又成功追踪到奥尔特云中的若干颗小行星。

Old Text: Minor discovery
Old Translation: 小发现

Text: We scanned a new section of the sky, but made no noteworthy discoveries.
Translation: 我们扫描了天空的新区域，但没有值得注意的新发现。

Old Text: Minor discovery
Old Translation: 小发现

Text: We have recorded a new Pulsar.
Translation: 我们记录了一颗新的脉冲星。
Old Text: We have recorded a new Pulsar
Old Translation: 我们记录了一颗新的脉冲星。

Old Text: Minor discovery

Text: We have discovered an exceptionally large Kuiper Belt Object.
Translation: 我们发现了一处异常巨大的柯伊伯带天体。

Old Text: Minor discovery

Text: We have captured detailed and beautiful images of a nebula.
Translation: 我们捕捉到一片星云详细而美丽的图像。

Translation: 我们记录到一次壮观的日珥。

Old Translation: 小发现

Text: Underground Marsquakes only occur in the Martian underground. These local tremors cause rocks and rubble to fall from the cave ceilings and can create new Cave-Ins as a result. Support Struts can reduce the impact of Underground Marsquakes and help protect our colony.
Translation: 地下地震只发生在火星地下。这些局部的震动导致岩石和碎石从洞穴顶部掉落，并制造新的塌方。 支撑柱能削弱地下地震的影响并保护我们的殖民地。

Text:
Exotic Minerals only appear on Asteroids and cannot be found on Mars itself. They can be obtained by going on mining missions to Asteroids that are within range of Mars. Exotic Minerals are mainly used to construct reinforced buildings that can withstand the harsh environments of the Martian Underground and Asteroids.
One thing that both Mars and Earth have in common is that they lack certain mineral compositions that are beneficial to the development of our colony. It has long been known that there are Asteroids rich in these Exotic Minerals, however mining them from Earth has always been problematic. Luckily Mars is much better suited as a base for these mining missions, allowing us to gain access to resources and technology that were out of practical reach before.
Translation:
奇异矿物只出现在小行星上，在火星上找不到。可以通过前往火星范围内的小行星进行采矿任务获得奇异矿物。 奇异矿物主要用来建造加固建筑，可以经受火星地下和小行星上的恶劣环境。
火星和地球有一个共同点，那就是它们都缺乏某些有益于建设我们殖民地的矿藏。长久以来，人们就知道这些小行星富含奇异矿物，然而从地球上开采这些矿物一直是个问题。很幸运，火星更适合作为采矿任务的基地，这能让我们获得以前实际无法获得的资源和技术。

Text: Asteroid Landers are specifically designed to ferry resources, prefabs, vehicles and Colonists from Mars to Asteroids and back. While they are perfect for these short and demanding trips, Asteroid Landers cannot make the journey between Mars and Earth. Asteroid Landers can be ordered from the Resupply screen or can be build on Mars directly once the required technology is researched. The cargo of Asteroid Landers can be selected and modified by using the Edit Payload action. Once cargo is requested Drones will start loading it into the rocket.
Translation: 小行星登陆舱是专门设计，用来在火星和小行星之间运载资源、预制件、载具和殖民地居民的。 小行星登陆舱虽然非常适合这些短途而苛刻的旅行，但它们无法在火星和地球间航行。 小行星登陆舱可以从重新补给屏幕上订购，也可以在研发了所需技术后直接在火星上建造。 小行星登陆舱的货物可以通过使用编辑货物操作来选择和修改。发出货物请求后，无人机就会开始将其装入火箭。
Old Text: Asteroid Landers are specifically designed to ferry resources, prefabs, vehicles and Colonists from Mars to Asteroids and back. While they are perfect for these short and demanding trips, cannot make the journey between Mars and Earth. Asteroid Landers can be ordered from the Resupply screen or can be build on Mars directly once the required technology is researched. The cargo of Asteroid Landers can be selected and modified by using the Edit Payload action. Once a cargo is requested Drones will start loading it into the rocket.
Old Translation: 小行星登陆舱是专门设计，用来在火星和小行星之间运载资源、预制件、载具和殖民地居民的。虽然非常适合这些短途而苛刻的旅行，但它们无法在火星和地球间航行。 小行星登陆舱可以从重新补给屏幕上订购，也可以在研发了所需技术后直接在火星上建造。 小行星登陆舱的货物可以通过使用编辑货物操作来选择和修改。发出货物请求后，无人机就会开始将其装入火箭。

Text: This modification allows RC Rovers to function on the micro-G environment of Asteroids. Once the technology is researched this modification is automatically applied to all RC Rovers that are deployed on Asteroids. The RC Rovers revert to their original configuration when they return to Mars.
Translation: 这项改造使遥控探测车可以在小行星的微重力环境中工作。 一旦相关科技研发完成，这项改造会自动应用在部署在小行星上的所有遥控探测车上。当遥控探测车返回火星时，它们将恢复到原始的配置。

Text:
Below the surface of Mars lies a system of volcanic tunnels and caves, filled with resources and secrets waiting to be uncovered.
To access the Martian underground an Elevator must be constructed. Elevators can only be constructed on top of Underground Passages on the surface of Mars and on top of Surface Passages in the Martian underground. Once an Elevator is constructed you can switch between a view of the surface and the underground using the Map Buttons in the bottom right of the screen. Resources and Colonists are not automatically moved between the surface and the underground. Both have to be moved manually from one to the other using the Elevator. Power and Life Support grids can not be connected between the surface and the underground.
Translation:
在火星地表之下，是一个火山隧道和洞穴系统，里面充满了有待发掘的资源和秘密。
要前往火星地下，必须建造电梯。电梯只能建在火星地表的地下通道顶部和火星地下的地表通道顶部。一旦电梯建好，你就可以用屏幕右下的地图按钮在地表和地下的视角之间切换。 资源和殖民地居民不会自动在地表和地下之间往返。他们都需要用电梯手动移动。 电力和生命供给供应网不能连接地表和地下世界。

Text: The Martian underground is dark and devoid of natural light. All resources and anomalies are hidden and can’t be revealed using Probes. Buildings, RC Rovers and Drones provide light that can reveal hidden Resource Deposits and Anomalies. Once revealed these Resource Deposits and Anomalies stay visible on the map, even when they are no longer illuminated. Buried Wonders can be found in the Martian underground. Once investigated, they can offer benefits to the colony. Parts of the Martian underground will be blocked by Cave-Ins that can be cleared once the required technology is researched.
Translation: 火星地下是黑暗的，没有自然光。所有的资源和异象都是隐藏的，只能用探机发现它们。 建筑、遥控探测车和无人机发出的光线能显示隐藏的资源点和异象。这些资源点和异象一旦被显示出来，即使不再被照亮，它们也可以在地图上看到。 在火星地下还能找到埋藏的奇观。一旦被调查，它们就能为殖民地提供益处。 火星地下有些地方会被塌方阻挡，研发完成所需的技术之后就能清理这些塌方。

Text: Asteroids are time limited, separate areas that can be visited by Asteroid Lander. There are different types of Asteroids each with different types and amounts of resources available on them. Asteroids are the only source of Exotic Minerals, but can also contain Metal, Rare Metals, Polymers and Water. In order to mine these resources, specific technology that can operate in the micro-G environment of the Asteroid is required. Asteroids can be discovered by Recon Centers. Once they are discovered Asteroids stay available until their time limit runs our or they are abandoned. Be careful - All Buildings, vehicles and resources present on an Asteroid when the time limit runs our are lost. Only three Asteroids can be tracked at once. The Asteroids that are currently available can be viewed in the Planetary View.
Translation: 小行星是小行星登陆舱可以访问的、限时的独立区域。有不同类型的小行星，每种小行星都储有不同类型和数量的可用资源。 小行星是奇异矿物的唯一来源，但同时它们也储有金属、稀有金属、聚合物和水资源。为了开采这些资源，需要能在小行星的微重力环境下工作的特定技术。 小行星能被侦察中心发现。被发现的小行星将一直可用，直至它们的时限结束或被废弃。当心：当时限结束时，小行星上所有的建筑、载具和现存资源都会丢失。 一次只能追踪三颗小行星。可以在行星视图界面中看到目前可用的小行星。

Text: Buried Wonders are unique structures that can be found in the Martian underground. They can be investigated by scanning the Anomaly associated with them. This starts a chain of events that can result in beneficial outcomes for the colony. There are several different Buried Wonders to be discovered.
Translation: 埋藏的奇观是能在火星地下发现的独特建筑。可以通过扫描和它们关联的异象来调查它们。这会开始一系列事件，最终为殖民地带来有益的结果。 待发现的埋藏的奇观有好几种类型。

Text: Once the Martian underground or an Asteroid become available, the game is played on multiple maps. Maps can be switched using the Map Buttons on the bottom right of the screen. Each separate map has its own set of notification, resources, Colonists, and Power and Life Support grids. Resources and Colonists can be moved between maps using Elevators and Asteroid Landers. The number of notification on inactive maps can be seen on the Map Buttons. Time passes at the same rate on each map. This means production on inactive maps continues as normal, but so do dust build up and disasters.
Translation: 一旦火星地下或小行星可用，游戏就会在多张地图上进行。可以用屏幕右下的地图按钮切换地图。 每张地图都分别有自己的通知、资源、殖民地居民和电力和生命供给供应网。可以使用电梯和小行星登陆舱在不同地图间输送资源和殖民地居民。在地图按钮上能看到未激活地图的通知数。 每张地图上的时间流逝速度是相同的。这意味着未激活地图上的生产在正常进行，但尘土累积和灾害也是一样。

Text: The Prefab-Refab technology allows most buildings to be turned back into prefabs. By using the Refab action on a building, Drones will be deployed to turn the building back into a prefab. Prefabs are tied to individual maps and can be moved to other maps using Elevators and Asteroid Landers.
Translation: 预制件重构技术可以让大多数建筑转化回预制件。通过对建筑使用重构操作，无人机将被部署并把建筑转化回预制件。 预制件与其所在的地图绑定，并可以通过电梯和小行星登陆舱运送至其他地图。

Text: Cave-Ins are obstructions that appear in the Martian Underground. They can only be cleared by Drones once the required technology is researched. New Cave-Ins can appear during Underground Marsquakes and certain events.
Translation: 塌方是出现在火星地下的障碍物。它们只能在研发了所需技术后用无人机清除。 新的塌方随着地下地震和特定事件的进行而出现。

Text:
<grey>"Things are only impossible until they are not."
<right>Jean-Luc Picard</grey><left>
Translation:
<grey>“可能与不可能仅在一念之间。”
<right>让-卢克·皮卡德</grey><left>
Old Text:
<grey>"Things are only impossible untill they are not."
<right>Jean-Luc Picard</grey><left>
Old Translation:
<grey>“可能与不可能仅在一念之间。”
<right>让-卢克·皮卡德</grey><left>

Text: Underground quakes rating set to a new Max level for all locations on Mars
Translation: 火星所有地区的地下地震风险都变为最高等级。

<grey>“要摇匀，不要搅动。”
<right>詹姆斯·邦德</grey><left>

Text: Underground Exotic Mineral deposits can be exploited by either Micro-G Auto Extractors or Micro-G Mining Stations. The later requires Colonists to operate.
Translation: 可用微重力自动挖掘站或微重力采矿站开采地下奇异矿物资源点。后者需要殖民地居民操作。
Old Text: We are not yet ready to exploit underground Exotic Minerals deposits. When Colonists arrive on Mars, they will be able to operate Exotic Minerals Extractors.
Old Translation: 我们目前还无法开采地下的奇异矿物资源。等殖民地居民到达火星后，他们可以操作奇异矿物挖掘站，使其正常运转。

Text: Asteroids are small locations that are only available for a short time. They contain Exotic Minerals and other valuable resources. Asteroids can only be visited with Asteroid Landers. The process can be started with the "Visit Asteroid" action of the Asteroid Lander or by selecting an Asteroid in the Planetary View. Asteroid Landers can be ordered from Earth similar to other rockets.
Translation: 小行星是可用时间很短的小型地点。它们储有奇异矿物和其他宝贵的资源。 只有小行星登陆舱可以访问小行星。可以通过小行星登陆舱的“访问小行星”操作，或是在行星视图中选择一颗小行星以开始该进程。和其他火箭类似，小行星登陆舱可以从地球订购。

Text: Asteroid Landers can be send to Asteroids by using the "Visit Asteroid" action or through the Planetary View. Once an Asteroid Lander and destination have been selected, cargo can be requested. Drones will load the requested cargo onto the Asteroid Lander. Once everything is loaded and the rocket is fueled up it will launch automatically. Plan your loadout carefully based on what is present on the Asteroid. And keep in mind Asteroid Landers need to be refueled on the Asteroid!
Translation: 可以使用“访问小行星”操作，或是通过行星视图将小行星登陆舱发射至小行星。 一旦选定了小行星登陆舱和目的地，就可以请求货物。无人机会将请求的货物装载至小行星登陆舱。所有货物装载完成，火箭加满燃料后就会自动发射。 根据小行星上拥有的资源谨慎选择携带的货物。记住，小行星登陆舱需要在小行星上补充燃料！
Old Text: Asteroid Landers can be send to Asteroids by using the "Visit Asteroid" action or through the Planetary View. Once an Asteroid Lander and destination have been selected, cargo can be requested. Drones will load the requested cargo onto the Asteroid Lander. Once everything is loaded and the rocket is fueled up it will launch automatically.
Old Translation: 可以使用“访问小行星”操作，或是通过行星视图将小行星登陆舱发射至小行星。 一旦选定了小行星登陆舱和目的地，就可以请求货物。无人机会将请求的货物装载至小行星登陆舱。所有货物装载完成，火箭加满燃料后就会自动发射。

Text: Asteroids can be mined with unique buildings such as the Micro-G Auto Extractor. The gathered resources need to be transported back to Mars with an Asteroid Lander. Keep in mind that the Asteroid Lander must be refueled for the return trip. When the time runs out, refueled Asteroid Landers depart back to Mars. Everything else left on the Asteroid is lost!
Translation: 可以用特定的建筑来开采小行星，比如微重力自动挖掘站。收集到的资源需要用小行星登陆舱输送回火星。记住，必须给小行星登陆舱补充燃料以返回火星。 当时间耗尽时，补充好燃料的小行星登陆舱就会返回火星。留在小行星的一切都会丢失！
Old Text: Asteroids can be mined with unique buildings such as the Micro-G Auto Extractor. The gathered resources need to be transported back to Mars with an Asteroid Lander. Keep in mind that the Asteroid Lander must be refueled for the return trip. Everything left on the Asteroid when time runs out is lost!
Old Translation: 可以用特定的建筑来开采小行星，比如微重力自动挖掘站。收集到的资源需要用小行星登陆舱输送回火星。记住，小行星登陆舱加注的燃料必须足够往返。 当时间耗尽时，小行星上剩下的一切东西都会丢失！

Text: The Recon Center can discover new Asteroids. Upon discovery they can opt to investigate the Asteroid further to provide more information before visiting the Asteroid. This costs which have to stored in Recon Centers as the Asteroid is discovered.
Translation: 侦察中心能发现新的小行星。 在发现的基础上，它们可以选择进一步调查小行星，以提供更多的信息，然后再访问小行星。当发现小行星时，花费的必须储存在侦察中心。

Text: The surface of Mars and the Underground are two independent maps that each have their own set of resources, vehicles, colonists and prefabs. Elevators function as a connection between these two maps. They can be used to move vehicles, resources, colonists and prefabs between the two maps. By using the Transport Cargo action on the Elevator, cargo can be selected that will be transported to the other side of the Elevator. Once a resource is loaded into the Elevator it is immediately transported to the other side.
Translation: 火星地表和地下是两张独立的地图，有各自的一系列资源、载具、殖民地居民和预制件。电梯的作用是连接这两张地图。它们能用来在两张地图之间转移载具、资源、殖民地居民和预制件。 对电梯进行运输货物操作可选择要运到电梯另一头的货物。资源装载进电梯后，就会立刻被运到另一头。
Old Text: The surface of Mars and the Underground are two independent maps that each have their own set of resources, vehicles, colonists and prefabs. Elevators function as a connection between these two maps. They can be used to move vehicles, resources, colonists and prefabs between the two maps. By using the Edit Payload action on the Elevator, cargo can be selected that will be transported to the other side of the Elevator. Once a resource is loaded into the Elevator it is immediately transported to the other side.
Old Translation: 火星地表和地下是两张独立的地图，有各自的一系列资源、载具、殖民地居民和预制件.电梯的作用是连接这两张地图。它们能用来在两张地图之间转移载具、资源、殖民地居民和预制件。 对电梯进行编辑货物操作可选择要晕倒电梯另一头的货物。资源装载进电梯后，就会立刻被运到另一头。

Text: Cave-ins are the result of Underground Marsquakes. During these events buildings in the Underground can also be covered by a Cave-in, making them inoperable until the rubble is cleared. Cave-ins can be cleared by Drones to free any buildings buried under the rubble and clear the space for construction.
Translation: 塌方是由地下地震所造成的。在这过程中，地下也会被塌方所掩埋，直到碎石被完全清除前都无法使用。 塌方可通过无人机清除，以此挖出被碎石掩埋的建筑，并清理出可供建造的空地。
Old Text: Cave-ins are blockages of rock and rubble that appear in the Martian underground. They can be cleared by Drones once the appropriate research is completed. Remembering the locations where Cave-ins obstruct the path can be useful as they often block access to valuable resources. Underground Marsquakes can cause new Cave-ins. During these events buildings in the underground can also be covered by a Cave-in, making them inoperable until the rubble is cleared.
Old Translation: 塌方是出现在火星地下的岩石和碎石堵塞物。完成相应研究后，就能用无人机清理塌方了。记住塌方堵塞通路的位置可能会有帮助，因为它们往往会挡住通往珍贵资源的道路。 地下地震可能会制造新的塌方。地震期间，地下建筑可能会被塌方掩埋，必须清理掉碎石才能恢复运转。

Text: Collapsed Tunnels consist of a large amount of rock and rubble blocking tunnels in the Martian underground. They can be cleared by Drones once the appropriate research is completed. Remembering the locations of Collapsed Tunnels can be useful as clearing them grants access to new areas of the underground.
Translation: 塌方的隧道中充斥着大量岩石与碎石，这些石头堵住了火星地下的隧道。在妥善调查后，使用可无人机清除阻碍。 需要记住塌方的隧道的地点，清除塌方后就可到达新的地下区域 。

Text: Exotic Minerals are materials required for the construction of various buildings in the Martian Underground and on Asteroids. Exotic Minerals can only be gathered on Asteroids. They appear in the form of surface deposits that can be harvested by Drones and as sub-surface deposits that require specialized buildings to mine.
Translation: 奇异矿物这种材料用来在火星地下以及小行星上建造各种建筑。 奇异矿物只能在小行星上收集到。它们可能是地表资源点，可以用无人机开采，也可能是地下资源点，需要专门的建筑开采。

Text: When multiple maps are available the Map Switch Panel is added to the UI, in the bottom right of the screen. Each map has its own button. Use it to switch between your colony maps. The Map Switch Panel shows the number of notifications for each map in the form of a number on the top right corner of the button. This number turns red if urgent matters require your attention. Check on the different maps regularly to keep an eye on the number of resources present there and address any urgent issues.
Translation: 存在多张可用地图时，用户界面上会出现地图切换面板，位于画面右下角。每张地图拥有各自的按钮。用它来切换殖民地地图。 地图切换面板会在每个按钮的右上角显示一个数字，代表每张地图的通知数量。如果发生了需要你关注的紧急情况，数字会变红。 经常查看不同的地图以留意资源数量并处理紧急情况。

Text: In the Martian Underground resource deposits and Anomalies are hidden. Use RC Rovers to uncover any deposit or Anomalythat are near the rover's path. Once they are revealed, they remain visible on the map even if there is no source of light present to illuminate the area.
Translation: 火星地下的资源点和异象是隐藏的。用遥控探测车可发现探测车移动路径附近的资源点或异象。 一经发现，它们就会在地图上持续可见，即使区域内没有光源也一样。

Text: Buried Wonders are phenomena that only appear in the Martian Underground. Investigating them yields great benefits to our efforts in the Martian Underground and for the colony as a whole. Start the investigation by scanning the Anomaly associated with each Buried Wonder.
Translation: 埋藏的奇观是只会出现在火星地下的现象。调查它们对我们在火星地下的事业以及整个殖民地都大有好处。 扫描与每个埋藏的奇观相关的异象以开始调查。

Text: Colonists living on Asteroids don’t require Food in order to survive as the Micro-G Habitat provides them with bland rations that offer plenty of nutrition. However, supplying Micro-G Habitats with Food from Mars improves the Health, Sanity and Comfort of the residents.
Translation: 居住在小行星上的殖民地居民存活不需要食物，因为微重力居住地为他们提供并不美味但营养充足的口粮。 不过，为微重力居住地提供来自火星的食物能提高居民的生命值、理智度和舒适度。
殖民地居民转化成了无人机！

Old Text: Damaged buildings
Old Translation: 受损的建筑

Old Text: Destroyed buildings
Old Translation: 被毁的建筑

Old Text: Click to view cave ins
Old Translation: 点击以查看塌方

Text: Radiation caused some power buildings to malfunction
Translation: 辐射导致部分供电建筑失灵
Old Text: Radiations caused power buildings to malfunction
Old Translation: 辐射导致供电建筑失灵

Text: Asteroid is moving out of range in <sols> Sols
Translation: 小行星将于<sols>个太阳日内离开范围

Text: The Asteroid has continued along its trajectory and moved out of range. We will no longer be able to reach it with Asteroid Landers and everything left behind on the Asteroid, or in its orbit, are now lost. Asteroid Landers ready for departure were able to get out at the very last second. They should appear on Mars shortly.
Translation: 小行星继续沿着它的轨道运行，并离开了我们的射程。我们再也无法用小行星登陆舱到达那里，留在小行星和其轨道上的一切也无法回收了。 准备好离开的小行星登陆舱成功地在最后一刻升空。它们应该很快就会出现在火星上。
Old Text: The Asteroid has continued along its trajectory and moved out of range. We will no longer be able to reach it with Asteroid Landers and everything left behind on the Asteroid, or in its orbit, are now lost.
Old Translation: 小行星继续沿着它的轨道运行，并离开了我们的射程。我们再也无法用小行星登陆舱到达那里，留在小行星和其轨道上的一切也无法回收了。

Text: A new Asteroid has been discovered!

Commander, our scientists have detected an Asteroid that will pass close by Mars. They have provided us with a time window in which it would be possible to travel to and from the Asteroid. Asteroids are a rich source of Exotic Minerals we cannot obtain here on Mars. We should take this opportunity to harvest these resources and take our first steps into mining Asteroids! We will need an Asteroid Lander in order to visit the Asteroid. We can order them from Earth similar to other rockets. We already have just a single Micro-G Auto Extractor prefab, but we can order more from Earth if we wish. Gain 1 Micro-G Auto Extractor Prefab
Translation: 指挥官，我们的科学家检测到一颗小行星即将经过火星附近。他们计算出了我们可以往返于小行星的时间段。 小行星富含奇异矿物，这是我们在火星上没法获取的资源。我们应该抓住这次机会收获这些资源，迈出我们开采小行星的第一步！ 我们将需要一枚小行星登陆舱来访问小行星。和其他火箭一样，我们可以从地球上订购它们。我们只有一个微重力自动挖掘站预制件，但如有需要，我们可以从地球订购更多。 获得1个微重力自动挖掘站预制件
Old Text: Commander, our scientists have detected an Asteroid that will pass close by Mars. They have provided us with a time window in which it would be possible to travel to and from the Asteroid. Asteroids are a rich source of Exotic Minerals we cannot obtain here on Mars. We should take this opportunity to harvest these resources and take our first steps into mining Asteroids! We will need an Asteroid Lander in order to visit the Asteroid. We can order them from Earth similar to other rockets. We already have just a single Micro-G Auto Extractor prefab, but we can order more from Earth if we wish.
Old Translation: 指挥官，我们的科学家检测到一颗小行星即将经过火星附近。他们计算出了我们可以往返于小行星的时间段。 小行星富含奇异矿物，这是我们在火星上没法获取的资源。我们应该抓住这次机会收获这些资源，迈出我们开采小行星的第一步！ 我们将需要一枚小行星登陆舱来访问小行星。和其他火箭一样，我们可以从地球上订购它们。我们只有一个微重力自动挖掘站预制件，但如有需要，我们可以从地球订购更多。

Text: We’ve made it! It is important to keep an eye on the time we have left on the Asteroid. When the window passes, we won’t have the means to return to Mars anymore. Everything left behind on the Asteroid when our time limit runs out will be lost forever. So, make sure the Asteroid Landers are loaded and refueled before our time here is up. To help with loading, Asteroid Landers have auto loading enabled. This starts the loading process of any resources we aren't using. Don't worry, they will be unloaded again when we build something, desire them in depots, or they are needed elsewhere. For now, let’s focus on gathering and mining as many Exotic Minerals and other valuables as we can!
Translation: 我们成功了！ 关注我们能在小行星上逗留的时间至关重要。时间段过去后，我们就再也没法返回火星了。当我们的时间耗尽时，所有遗留在小行星上的东西都将无法回收。确保我们的小行星登陆舱在时间耗尽之前装载完毕并补充好燃料。 为方便装载，小行星登陆舱开启了自动装载功能。此操作将开始装载一切我们未在使用的资源。别担心，当我们建造东西或想要将资源运进仓库，或有别的地方需要这些资源时，还可以将其从登陆舱中卸下。 现在，我们只需要专心收集与开采尽可能多的奇异矿物以及其他珍贵资源即可！
Old Text: We’ve made it! It is important to keep an eye on the time we have left on the Asteroid. When the window passes, we won’t have the means to return to Mars anymore. Everything left behind on the Asteroid when our time limit runs out will be lost forever. So, make sure the Asteroid Landers are loaded and refueled before our time here is up. For now, let’s focus on gathering and mining as many Exotic Minerals and other valuables as we can!
Old Translation: 我们成功了！ 关注我们能在小行星上逗留的时间至关重要。时间段过去后，我们就再也没法返回火星了。当我们的时间耗尽时，所有遗留在小行星上的东西都将无法回收。因此，确保我们的小行星登陆舱在时间耗尽之前装载完毕并补充燃料。 至于现在，我们集中精力收集并开采尽可能多的奇异矿物和其他贵重物品吧！

Text: Commander, our time on the Asteroid is running out! We only have 2 Sols left to refuel and load up our rocket. If we still have space left it would be wise to salvage as many structures as we can before departing. Once the Asteroid goes out of range, everything remaining on the Asteroid will be lost. As a fail safe we have programmed Asteroid Landers to depart at the last possible moment as long as they are refueled. But it is probably better not to rely too heavily on this.
Translation: 指挥官，我们在小行星上的时间不多了！ 我们只有2个太阳日来装载火箭并补充燃料了。在我们离开前，如果我们还有剩余空间，回收尽可能多的建筑将是明智的选择。 一旦小行星离开射程，留在它上面的一切都将无法回收。保险起见，我们已经用程序设定小行星登陆舱在加注完毕燃料后，将于最后的关头离开。不过最好不要过于依赖它。
Old Text: Commander, our time on the Asteroid is running out! We only have 2 Sols left to refuel and load up our rocket. If we still have space left it would be wise to salvage as many structures as we can before departing. Once the Asteroid goes out of range, everything remaining on the Asteroid will be lost. This includes any Asteroid Landers in orbit. As a fail safe we have programmed Asteroid Landers to depart at the last possible moment as long as they are refueled. But it is probably better not to rely too heavily on this.
Old Translation: 指挥官，我们在小行星上的时间不多了！ 我们只有2个太阳日来装载火箭并补充燃料了。在我们离开前，如果我们还有剩余空间，回收尽可能多的建筑将是明智的选择。 一旦小行星离开射程，留在它上面的一切都将无法回收。包括在轨道上的小行星登陆舱。保险起见，我们已经用程序设定小行星登陆舱在加注完毕燃料后，将于最后的关头离开。不过最好不要过于依赖它。

Text: Space exploration is hard and today was a harsh reminder of that. But even though the losses will be felt, it has taught us some valuable lessons. Do not give up commander, there will be more opportunities to harvest similar Asteroids in the future. We will ensure that we are more prepared and will not repeat our mistakes. We have made it to Mars, I am confident that we can clear this hurdle as well.
Translation: 太空探索绝非易事，今天我们就栽了跟头。但是，尽管失败是痛苦的，它还是给我们上了宝贵的一课。 指挥官别放弃，将来还会有更多的机会开采类似的小行星。我们要做的就是确保做好更充分的准备，不要重蹈覆辙。我们已经成功登上火星，相信我们能跨越这个障碍。

Text: We have managed to return to Mars in one piece! We are sure to get more opportunities to harvest Asteroids that pass in close proximity to Mars. By further developing our technology, we will increase our efficiency and yield from these trips. Keep an eye on the skies commander, our road to progress might be up there.
Translation: 我们毫发无损地回到了火星！ 我们一定还有机会开采接近火星的小行星。通过进一步发展我们的技术，我们将提升此类短途飞行的效率和收益。指挥官请注意天空，也许那里有东西能推动我们的进步。

Text: Go to Resupply View to request an Asteroid Lander from Earth (you will still have to setup the Expedition later)
Translation: 前往重新补给视图并向地球申请一枚小行星登陆舱（之后你仍需要设置探险队）

Text: We have no available Asteroid Landers that are required for this action.
Translation: 我们目前没有此次行动所需的小行星登陆舱。

Text: The requested payload has not been fully loaded into the Asteroid Lander yet. If the Lander launches now, only loaded resources and cargo marked as ready will be brought along.<newline><newline>To complete the loading process, make sure the resources are within the vicinity of the Asteroid Lander so drones can carry them in. Also make sure you have enough Rovers, Drones, Colonists and Prefabs present on the map. These are automatically loaded in upon departure.
Translation: 请求的货物尚未全部装载进小行星登陆舱。如果现在发射登陆舱，则只会带上装载的资源和标记为准备就绪的货物。<newline><newline>确保资源位于小行星登陆舱的附近，好让无人机将其运入登陆舱，以完成装载过程。也要确保你在地图上拥有足够的探测车、无人机、殖民地居民和预制件。这些都会在离开时自动装载进登陆舱。
发射问题：缺少请求的货物

Text: There is no cargo requested, the rocket will depart without cargo once it is refueled.
Translation: 未请求货物。火箭补充完燃料后会不装载货物直接出发。

Text: There are passengers on board but there's no living space on the Asteroid yet. So make sure you bring enough to build a Micro-G Habitat, which has room for residents.
Translation: 有名乘客，但小行星上暂无生活空间。一定要携带足够建造一处微重力居住地的资源，其中能容纳位居民。

Text: There are passengers on board but there's only space for new residents on the Asteroid.
Translation: 有名乘客，但小行星只能容纳名新居民。

Text: We'll contact them if we find the rover
Translation: 我们如果找到探测车，就联系他们

Text:
The Russian agency just contacted our colony about a lost rover.

The rover happens to be located on the asteroid we've been investigating. The rover stopped giving signs of life near the end of its mission, preventing it from relaying its precious data to its owners.

They wish to recover the data and samples as well as the malfunctioning element to improve their next rovers and continue their research on a new material. 

As a reward, we can dismantle the rest of the rover and use its equipment for our own goals.
Translation:
俄罗斯机构刚刚就一部失踪的探测车联系了我们的殖民地。

该探测车恰好就在我们正在调查的小行星上。探测车在任务接近尾声时失去了生命迹象，没能给它的拥有者转发回宝贵的数据。

他们希望能取回数据、样本和故障部件，以便改进他们的下一部探测车，并继续研究一种新材料。

作为奖励，我们可以分解探测车剩余的部分，得到的设备归我们自己。

Text:
The latest update added new upgrades and content to the Buried Wonders found in the Underground. Each one now has new benefits to unlock (upgrades, breakthroughs and even a new building) that benefit your entire colony.

The event chains for the Buried Wonders need to be restarted to enable the new content. You will not lose any techs, buildings or other benefits already gained.
Translation:
最新升级带来了新升级与可在地下发现的埋藏的奇观内容。每种起观解锁后都会给你的整个殖民地带来利益（升级、突破性技术，甚至是新建筑）。

需要重新开始埋藏的奇观事件链来启用新内容。你不会失去任何技术、建筑或其他已经获得的利益。

Text:
We discovered a deep pit that connects to a network of caverns and lava tubes! Our initial scans show some odd readings. We should be able to build an elevator to get vehicles and resources down.

The low gravity on Mars allows for much larger lava tubes and caverns than on Earth. Inside the temperatures are a lot less extreme and they provide protection from hazards on the surface. Because of this, researchers believe life on Mars, if it exists at all, will most likely be found in the underground.
Translation:
我们发现了连接着熔岩管和洞穴网络的深坑！初步扫描得出的读数有些奇怪。我们应该能造一座电梯，把载具和资源送下去。

在火星低重力环境下形成的熔岩管和洞穴比地球上的大得多。里面的温度比地球上的低得多，在里面还能躲避地表的灾害。因此，研究员们认为假如火星上有生命，那十有八九能在地下找到。

Old Text: We'll start researching elevator right away!
Old Translation: 我们立刻开始研究电梯！

Translation: 我们还是研发电梯好了！

Text:
We discovered a deep pit that connects to a network of caverns and lava tubes! Our initial scans show some odd readings. We should be able to build an elevator to get vehicles and resources down.

The low gravity on Mars allows for much larger lava tubes and caverns than on Earth. Inside the temperatures are a lot less extreme and they provide protection from hazards on the surface. Because of this, researchers believe life on Mars, if it exists at all, will most likely be found in the underground.

The pit is big enough to send one RC Explorer down, however it is a one-way trip for now. What should we do?
Translation:
我们发现了连接着熔岩管和洞穴网络的深坑！初步扫描得出的读数有些奇怪。我们应该能造一座电梯，把载具和资源送下去。

在火星低重力环境下形成的熔岩管和洞穴比地球上的大得多。里面的温度比地球上的低得多，在里面还能躲避地表的灾害。因此，研究员们认为假如火星上有生命，那十有八九能在地下找到。

深坑大到足够派一辆遥控探索者下去，但可能有去无回。我们该怎么办？
Old Text:
We discovered a deep pit that connects to a network of caverns and lava tubes! Our initial scans show some odd readings. We should be able to build an elevator to get an RC Explorer down.

The low gravity on Mars allows for much larger lava tubes and caverns than on Earth. Inside the temperatures are a lot less extreme and they provide protection from hazards on the surface. Because of this, researchers believe life on Mars, if it exists at all, will most likely be found in the underground.
Old Translation:
我们发现了连接着熔岩管和洞穴网络的深坑！初步扫描得出的读数有些奇怪。我们应该能造一座电梯，把遥控探索者送下去。

在火星低重力环境下形成的熔岩管和洞穴比地球上的大得多。里面的温度比地球上的低得多，在里面还能躲避地表的灾害。因此，研究员们认为假如火星上有生命，那十有八九能在地下找到。

Text:
The RC Explorer contacted us by radio, it arrived safely!
We should follow it!

Enter The Underground by clicking on the new icon in the bottom right corner.
Translation:
遥控探索者用无线电联系了我们，它安全到达了！
我们应该跟随它！

点击右下角的新图标进入地下。

Text: A connected network of tunnels and caverns
Translation: 相连的隧道和洞穴网络

Text:
Further scans show a connected network of rooms and tunnels. There are still a few strange structures that we have trouble identifying. We should explore further and uncover the secrets Mars has been keeping from us all this time.

The scans also indicate richer deposits and tunnels spacious enough to expand our colony into down here. Unfortunately, many places still appear a bit unstable, so we should be careful.

We've equipped the RC Vehicles with specialized scanning equipment to reveal any anomalies and resource deposits in the underground.
Translation:
进一步扫描显示出一个相连的房间与隧道网络。仍有一些我们难以识别的怪异结构。我们应该进一步探索以发现火星一直对我们隐瞒的秘密。

扫描还发现了储量丰富的资源点，以及空间足够我们殖民地扩张的隧道。不幸的是，很多地方似乎还不太稳定，所以我们应该多加小心。

我们已经给遥控载具安装了特制的扫描设备以发现地下的异象以及资源点。
异象已分析：远古种族制品

Text:
Our Explorer vehicle’s systems blacked out. All attempts to reboot it have failed, it seems like something is interfering with the control system. Drones are acting strangely, reassigning themselves to tasks that were not scheduled. Our scientists are convinced this ancient artifact is the underlying cause of this chaos.

We detected radio waves coming from the device, that for the time being are limited to the area of the Ancient Artifact. Our engineers think they could build an Artifact Interface to contain and even control its effect. Some scientists, however, think we should experiment more before diving into such costly research.

<effect> The Ancient Artifact Control tech has become available. Research it to build the Artifact Interface which should allow us to make use of the Ancient Artifact's power.
Translation:
我们探索者载具的系统失灵了。所有重启的尝试都失败了，看起来是有东西在干扰控制系统。无人机的行为很怪异，它们在自己给自己分配没有计划的任务。我们的科学家确信，这个远古种族制品就是这次混乱的根源。

目前，我们仅在有远古种族制品的区域检测到从这个设备发射出的无线电波。我们的工程师认为他们可以建造一个制品接口，来限制甚至控制这种效果。但是，一部分科学家认为我们在花费代价投入研究之前，应该进行更多的实验。

<effect>远古种族制品控制技术现已可用。研究此技术即可建造制品接口，我们应该能用它来运用远古种族制品的力量。
Old Text:
Our Explorer vehicle’s systems blacked out. All attempts to reboot it have failed, it seems like something is interfering with the control system. Drones are acting strangely, reassigning themselves to tasks that were not scheduled. Our scientists are convinced this ancient artifact is the underlying cause of this chaos.

We detected radio waves coming from the device, that for the time being are limited to the area of the Ancient Artifact. Our engineers think they could build an Artifact Interface to contain and even control its effect. Some scientists, however, think we should experiment more before diving into such costly research.

<effect> The Ancient Artifact Control tech has become available for the Ancient Artifact. Research it to build it on the Ancient Artifact and make use of its power.
Old Translation:
我们探索者载具的系统失灵了。所有重启的尝试都失败了，看起来是有东西在干扰控制系统。无人机的行为很怪异，它们在自己给自己分配没有计划的任务。我们的科学家确信，这个远古种族制品就是这次混乱的根源。

目前，我们仅在有远古种族制品的区域检测到从这个设备发射出的无线电波。我们的工程师认为他们可以建造一个制品接口，来限制甚至控制这种效果。但是，一部分科学家认为我们在花费代价投入研究之前，应该进行更多的实验。

<effect>远古种族制品控制技术现已可用。研究以将其建造在远古种族制品上，来利用制品的力量。

Text: An Ancient Artifact is emitting strange radio signals that seem to mess with our drones and RC vehicles. Objective: Build the Artifact Interface. Optional: Run more experiments with the Ancient Artifact.
Translation: 一件远古种族制品正在发射怪异的无线电信号，这种信号似乎在干扰我们的无人机和遥控载具。 目标：建造制品接口。 可选：用远古种族制品进行更多实验。

Text:
Construction of the Artifact Interface went without a hitch. Our colonists were very hesitant when approaching the artifact to connect the cables, but even that seemed to go without trouble. When turning on the interface, for a moment all nearby drones ominously drove towards it for a moment. They gradually returned to work as the interface fully got up and running.

The artifact seems to be more potent than we thought. Not only is it able to send radio signals throughout the underground, it's also able to remotely charge all drones we connect to it. Our scientists even found hundreds of other protocols we may be able to access. They've got a number of upgrades in mind.

<effect> Unlocked an upgrade for the Artifact Interface
Translation:
我们顺利完成了制品接口的建造工作。殖民地居民在靠近制品连接电缆时十分犹豫，不过期间没有遇到任何问题。打开接口时，有那么一刻，附近所有无人机都鬼使神差地驶向它。随着接口完全启动，无人机又逐渐返回了工作岗位。

外星制品似乎比我们想象得更强大。它不仅能在地下发射无线电信号，还能给所有与之相连的无人机远距离充电。我们的科学家还找到了数百种我们或许能访问的其他协议。我们已经想好不少升级方案了。

<effect>已解锁制品接口的一项升级

Text: Could it's power truly be unlimited?
Translation: 它的电力真的是无限的吗？

Text: The Ancient Artifact appears to be a powerful transmitter, able to control and remotely recharge drones across the entire underground. But we're only tapping into a fraction of its capabilities. Objective: Upgrade the Ancient Artifact.
Translation: 远古种族制品似乎是一个强大的发射器，能控制整个地下的无人机，并给它们远距离充电。但我们仅仅开发出了它能力的冰山一角。 目标：升级远古种族制品。
远古种族制品：接口已连接

Text:
We've connected the Artifact Interface to our main systems, giving us the processing power required to access most of the Ancient Artifact's capabilities. It seems to have greatly boosted its output signals, reaching far beyond our colony.

Drones have spontaneously started carrying extra resources all across our colony, including it's furthest reaches, and have become seemingly unstoppable. It looks like this is as far as we can go with the Ancient Artifact, controlling about 80-90% of it's capabilities.

<effect> All drones become indestructible, no longer need recharging and can carry 1 additional resource.
Translation:
我们已将制品接口与我们的主系统相连，现在我们拥有了足够强的处理能力，可以访问远古种族制品的大部分功能了。它似乎大幅加强了输出信号，覆盖范围远超我们的殖民地。

整个殖民地（包括最偏远地区）的所有无人机同时开始运输更多资源，而且似乎变得永远不会停工。我们已经发挥出了远古种族制品80%-90%的性能，在这方面似乎已经没法进一步取得进展了。

<effect>所有无人机变为不可破坏，不再需要充电，且能额外携带1单位资源。

Text: We're controlling as much of the Ancient Artifact as we ever will. Let's hope it stays this way.
Translation: 我们对远古种族制品的控制已经达到极限。希望这种情况能持续下去。

Text: We discovered that drones that spent time close to the Ancient Artifact lose additional battery charge. We want to experiment with drones but unfortunately we currently have too few of them. We need at least 5 drones to start the experiment.
Translation: 我们发现，无人机在接近这件远古种族制品时，会失去额外电池电量。我们想用无人机做实验，但目前无人机数量太少了。 我们需要至少5部无人机以开始实验。

Text: Wait until more drones are available in the underground.
Translation: 等待直到地下有更多可用无人机。
远古种族制品：为它供能！

Text:
We discovered that drones that spent time close to the Ancient Artifact lose additional battery charge. There is no scientific consensus yet, but some scientists suggest we could experiment with powering the Ancient Artifact directly. In order to keep the buildings safe our engineers have created an experimental protocol involving only drones. 

All you have to do is give the green light, commander.
Translation:
我们发现，无人机在接近这件远古种族制品时，会失去额外电池电量。对此现象目前还没有科学上的共识，但一部分科学家建议我们可以试试直接为远古种族制品提供电力。为确保建筑物的安全，我们的工程师们制订了一个只涉及无人机的实验协议。

你只需要批准它即可，指挥官。

Text:
Powering the Ancient Artifact resulted in a brief spike in its signal strength. It then proceeded to release an electromagnetic pulse damaging a few drones in the surrounding area. The reaction is proof that we are on the right track, but the behavior of this artifact has some colonists worried. If a few kilowatts can damage distant drones, who knows what megawatts could do… 

<effect> Gain <research(reg_param1)> Research
Translation:
为远古种族制品提供电力导致了它的信号强度出现短暂峰值。然后，它继续释放一组电磁脉冲，损坏了周边区域的几架无人机。这种反应证明了我们的研究方向是正确的，但制品的行为让一些殖民地居民感到担忧。如果几千瓦的功率就能损坏远处的无人机，那几兆瓦呢……

<effect>获得<research(reg_param1)>研究点数

The reaction is proof that we are on the right track, but the behavior of this artifact has some colonists worried. If a few kilowatts can damage distant drones, who knows what megawatts could do… 

<effect> Gain <research(1000)>

<effect>研究10%的远古种族制品控制

Text: 5 drones were destroyed by the Ancient Artifact
Translation: 远古种族制品摧毁了5架无人机

Text: Our first experiment fried a few nearby drones but was an overall success.
Translation: 我们的首次实验报废了附近的几架无人机，但总体而言是成功的。
远古种族制品：更多的能量！

Text: We are ready to connect the Ancient Artifact to our main grid. Some engineers claim the gigantic machine "reacted" when they approached it with our power cables, though they seem unable to prove any of these claims. Our electrical engineers are still calculating the risks of a potential blackout caused by a high voltage surge. Whatever power this thing is hiding, it will be ours soon...
Translation: 我们准备好把远古种族制品连接到我们的主电网了。有些工程师声称当他们将这台巨型机器连接至我们的电缆时，它“做出了反应”，但他们似乎无法证实这些说法。我们的电气工程师还在计算因为高压浪涌引发断电的风险可能性。不管这东西隐藏着什么能量，它马上就会是我们的了……

Text: Connect the Artifact to the power grid.

Even though we prepared for the possibility, the surge caused by the Ancient Artifact was much more violent than we accounted for. Several power producing buildings have been damaged as a result. 

It is interesting to note that no drones were damaged this time. Instead, all drones stopped working for a few seconds and turned toward the Ancient Artifact. They resumed their programmed work directly after the curious event. Our scientists and engineers theorize that the Ancient Artifact acts like a very efficient antenna, we just need to understand how to use it.

For our last experiment we’ll need to get some of our colonists into the underground. Five volunteers should do. 

<effect> Gain <research(reg_param1)> Research
Translation:
尽管我们已经做好了准备，但远古种族制品引发的浪涌还是比我们想象的要剧烈得多。结果就是，几处发电建筑遭到了破坏。

有意思的是，这次没有无人机受到损坏。相反，所有的无人机都停止了工作，几秒钟后，开始向远古种族制品移动。这一奇特的现象结束后，它们又开始按照程序继续工作了。我们的科学家和工程师们从理论上推断，远古种族制品就像一根非常灵敏的天线，我们只需要了解如何使用它即可。

我们最近一次的实验中，需要让几名殖民地居民进入地下。五名志愿者应该足够了。

<effect>获得<research(reg_param1)>研究点数

<effect> Research <reg_param1>% of Ancient Artifact Control
Translation:
尽管我们已经做好了准备，但远古种族制品引发的浪涌还是比我们想象的要剧烈得多。结果就是，几处发电建筑遭到了破坏。

有意思的是，这次没有无人机受到损坏。相反，所有的无人机都停止了工作，几秒钟后，开始向远古种族制品移动。这一奇特的现象结束后，它们又开始按照程序继续工作了。我们的科学家和工程师们从理论上推断，远古种族制品就像一根非常灵敏的天线，我们只需要了解如何使用它即可。

我们最近一次的实验中，需要让几名殖民地居民进入地下。五名志愿者应该足够了。

<effect>研究<reg_param1>%的远古种族制品控制
Old Text:
Even though we prepared for the possibility, the surge caused by the Ancient Artifact was much more violent than we accounted for. Several power producing buildings have been damaged as a result. 

It is interesting to note that no drones were damaged this time. Instead, all drones stopped working for a few seconds and turned toward the Ancient Artifact. They resumed their programmed work directly after the curious event. Our scientists and engineers theorize that the Ancient Artifact acts like a very efficient antenna, we just need to understand how to use it.

For our last experiment we’ll need to get some of our colonists into the underground. Five volunteers should do. 

<effect> Research 30% of Ancient Artifact Control

我们最近一次的实验中，需要让几名殖民地居民进入地下。五名志愿者应该足够了。

Text: The price of knowledge is steep indeed.
Buildings were damaged by the Ancient Artifact's surge
Translation: 远古种族制品的浪涌损坏了建筑
Old Text: Buildings were damaged by The Ancient Artifact's surge
Old Translation: 远古种族制品的浪涌损坏了建筑

Text: Our second experiment triggered a power surge breaking a few buildings, but we did learn vital information about the Artifact.
Translation: 我们的第二次实验触发了一次电力浪涌，导致若干栋建筑受损，但我们也了解到了有关制品的关键信息。
远古种族制品：实验需求

Text: We finally understand how the Ancient Artifact works! Or at least we know what it does. It has the power to transmit radio signals through the entire Underground. Its capabilities would greatly benefit our efforts to expand into the Martian underground. All that remains is to reprogram its directives as currently the signals are more or less random. No humans have gotten in direct contact with the Artifact yet, and we can't guarantee it will not affect them. We need at least 5 colonists to proceed.
Translation: 我们终于明白远古种族制品是怎么工作的了！或者说，至少我们知道它能做什么。它的能力是在整个地下世界传输无线电信号。它的能力将极大地促进我们发展火星地下世界的努力。 剩下要做的就是重新编译它的指令，因为现在的信号多多少少是随机的。目前还没有人类直接接触到这个制品，我们也无法保证它不会影响他们。 我们需要至少5名殖民地居民才能继续。

Text: Wait until more colonists are available in the underground.
Translation: 等待直到地下有更多可用的殖民地居民。

Text: Wait until the Artifact Interface is ready.
Translation: 等待制品接口准备就绪。

Text: Scan it to experiment with the Ancient Artifact
Translation: 扫描远古种族制品来进行实验

Text: The Ancient Artifact: 3rd Time's the Charm
Translation: 远古种族制品：三次一定行

Text:
We finally understand how the Ancient Artifact works! Or at least we know what it does. It has the power to transmit radio signals through the entire Underground. Its capabilities would greatly benefit our efforts to expand into the Martian underground.

All that remains is to reprogram its directives as currently the signals are more or less random. No humans have gotten in direct contact with the Artifact yet, and we can't guarantee it will not affect them. Luckily, it seems we have plenty of volunteers, but they’d better be prepared for the worst.
Translation:
我们终于明白远古种族制品是怎么工作的了！或者说，至少我们知道它能做什么。它的能力是在整个地下世界传输无线电信号。它的能力将极大地促进我们发展火星地下世界的努力。

剩下要做的就是重新编译它的指令，因为现在的信号多多少少是随机的。目前还没有人类直接接触到这个制品，我们也无法保证它不会影响他们。幸运的是，我们似乎有很多志愿者，但他们还是做好最坏的打算为妙。

Text: Have one of the volunteering colonists reprogram the Ancient Artifact.
Translation: 让一名殖民地居民自愿重新编译远古种族制品。
Old Text: Have one of the volunteering engineers reprogram the Ancient Artifact.
Old Translation: 让一名工程师自愿重新编译远古种族制品。

Text: Wait and rely on the Artifact Interface.

It appears that the volunteering colonists have turned into… Drones!? Did the Artifact perceive them as machines with bugs in their code and remake them accordingly? The odds of us finding out at this point are slim. 

More and more colonists are becoming fearful of the Artifact, and they are petitioning us to cease the experiments. We have to acknowledge the voice of the people; we will have to solely rely on the Artifact Interface from now on…

<effect> Gain <research(reg_param1)> Research
Translation:
殖民地居民志愿者似乎变成了……无人机？！制品是把他们当成了代码出错的机器，并将其重新生成了吗？我们现在搞清楚情况的几率十分渺茫。

越来越多的殖民地居民开始对制品感到恐惧，他们向我们请愿停止这项实验。我们必须听从人民的呼声；从现在起，我们将不得不完全依赖于制品接口……

<effect>获得<research(reg_param1)>研究点数
远古种族制品：我的天呐！

Text: We flew too close to the sun.
Some colonists have been changed into drones by the Ancient Artifact
Translation: 一些殖民地居民被远古种族制品转化成了无人机
Old Text: 5 colonists have been changed into drones by the Ancient Artifact
Old Translation: 5名殖民地居民被远古种族制品转化成了无人机

Text: Our third experiment was a failure, a few of our colonists got turned into... Drones!? We must rely on the Artifact Interface from now on.
Translation: 我们的第三次实验失败了，有几位殖民地居民被变成了……无人机！？从今以后我们必须依赖制品接口。

Old Text: Anomaly Analyzed : The Pit
Old Translation: 异象已分析：深坑

Text:
We discovered what appears to be an enormous pit. The engineers on location decided to run some rudimentary experiments to determine the depth of the pit, they have yet to hear any sound from the various rocks they threw in. 

Some other engineers believe we should build a dedicated Bottomless Pit Lab to find if the pit is bottomless instead of this more primitive approach. In the meantime, we can choose to keep running more low-tech experiments.
 
<effect> The Bottomless Pit Lab breakthrough has become available. Research it to build it on the Bottomless Pit and start experimenting.
Translation:
我们发现了一处巨大的深坑。在场的工程师们决定做几个基础的实验来测量坑的深度，他们丢进去了各种石头，但现在还没有听到回声。

还有的工程师则认为，我们应该建造一间专门的无底深坑实验室来查明这坑是不是无底的，而不是用这种较为原始的方法。不过，我们仍可以选择继续进行这种技术含量较低的实验。

<effect>无底深坑实验室的突破性技术现已可用。研究该技术即可在无底深坑上建造实验室并开始实验。

Text: We found an incredibly deep pit of a still unspecified depth. Our scientists are intrigued and would like to run more experiments. Objective: Build the Bottomless Pit Lab. Optional: Run some extra experiments before building the lab.
Translation: 我们找到了一处深度尚未确定的深坑。我们的科学家对此很感兴趣，想要进行更多实验。 目标：建造无底深坑实验室。 可选：在建造实验室之前，再进行几次实验。
无底深坑实验室已完成

Text:
Our engineers must admit that having the lab should make it a lot easier to experiment with the Pit and try to discern its true nature. Throwing in any excess resources you have should give us useful research data.

Our engineers and scientists also came up with a set of more elaborate experiments. Using the equipment of the lab and the specific experiment parameters, they feel confident we can once and for all determine how deep this pit is.
Translation:
我们的工程师必须承认，有了实验室后，对深坑进行实验并设法了解其本质应该会变得容易很多。把多余的资源扔进去应该能给我们提供有用的研究数据。

我们的工程师和科学家还想出了一系列更加复杂的实验。他们使用实验室里的设备以及特定的实验参数，有信心能一劳永逸地确定坑的深度。

Text: The Bottomless Pit Lab should prove useful for research. Objective: Run the experiments of the Bottomless Pit Lab.
Translation: 无底深坑实验室对研究应该十分有用。 目标：进行无底深坑实验室的实验。

Text:
After all our experiments, the most crazy conclusion also seems to be the most likely one. Thus, using Occam's razor, we must conclude this pit truly is bottomless.

Our scientists are still happy to keep throwing in resources for our research efforts, though they've accepted any more big experiments are futile and won't give us any better understanding of this pit.
Translation:
我们进行四次实验后，得出了一个最离谱但似乎也是最合理的结论。因此，运用简约之法则，我们必须得出的结论是这个深坑还真是无底的。

我们的科学家依然热衷于为了研究而往里面扔资源，不过他们也承认，继续进行大型实验也是徒劳，无法加深我们对深坑的理解。

Text: Alright, thank everyone for their efforts.
Translation: 好吧，谢谢大家，你们辛苦了。

Text: We've learned all there is to learn about the Bottomless Pit.
Translation: 关于无底深坑，我们的了解已经到极限了。

Text: The engineers believe the Bottomless Pit Lab is a waste of time, and are asking for permission for another experiment. Or to put it in their word: “We don’t need a fancy building to toss things into this pit. Just give us something you don’t need and we’ll get you results!” We need at least stored in a dumping site.
Translation: 有的工程师认为无底深坑实验室是浪费时间，他们在申请进行新实验的许可。他们的原话是：“只不过是把东西丢进坑里而已，何必盖一栋花里胡哨的楼。把你们不需要的东西给我们，我们就能拿出结果给你们看！” 我们至少需要垃圾场储有。

Text: Wait until enough waste rock has been collected (<wasterock(choice_param2, choice_param1)> collected).
Translation: 等待收集足够的矿渣（已收集<wasterock(choice_param2, choice_param1)>）。

Old Text: The Pit : Proof by Experiment
Old Translation: 深坑：实验证明

Text:
The engineers believe the Bottomless Pit Lab is a waste of time, and are asking for permission for another experiment. Or to put it in their word: “We don’t need a fancy building to toss things into this pit. Just give us something you don’t need and we’ll get you results!”

What do we do Commander?
Translation:
有的工程师认为无底深坑实验室是浪费时间，他们在申请另一次实验的许可。用他们的原话说：“只不过是把东西丢进坑里而已，何必盖一栋花里胡哨的楼。把你们不需要的东西给我们，我们就能拿出结果给你们看！”

我们该怎么办，指挥官？

Text: Allow Bottomless Pit experiments (Throw <wasterock(choice_param1)> in the pit)
Translation: 允许进行无底深坑实验（把<wasterock(choice_param1)>扔进坑里）
Old Text: Allow Bottomless Pit experiments (Throw <wasterock(10000)> in the pit)
Old Translation: 允许进行无底深坑实验（把<wasterock(10000)>扔进坑里）

Text: Cordon off the pit while we are waiting for the Bottomless Pit Lab.
Translation: 我们在等待无底深坑实验室的同时封锁深坑。

Text:
We waited a few seconds to hear something back. Seconds turned to minutes until our engineers finally lost patience. Even something as large as this did not result in a usable echo. 

Either the pit has extremely bad acoustics, or it is indeed bottomless. Nevertheless, the engineers went back to the drawing board. They haven’t given up yet.

<effect> Gain <research(reg_param1)> Research
Translation:
我们原以为几秒钟就能听到回声。结果几秒钟变成了几分钟，最后我们的工程师们终于失去了耐心。连这么大的东西都没法有效产生回声。

要么这个坑的声学效果很差，要么它真的是无底洞。不过，工程师们还是回到了绘图板旁。他们还没有放弃。

<effect>获得<research(reg_param1)>研究点数

Text: Dropping rocks into the pit didn't give us much new info. They'd like to run some more experiments before building the lab.
Translation: 往坑里丢石头没能为我们提供多少信息。在建造实验室之前，他们再进行几次实验。

Text: A new experiment protocol has been drafted to put an end to the debate on the existence of a bottom to the Pit! This time, the engineers want to gather data by “deploying” a device packed with sensors and lights. They reckon a drone is a perfect fit for the job. We need at least 1 drone to start the experiment.
Translation: 为了结束有关深坑是否有底的争论，一项新的实验协议已经起草完毕。这次，工程师们想通过“布署”一台装有传感器和灯光的装置来收集数据。他们认为一架无人机最适合这项任务。 我们需要至少1架无人机来开始实验。

Text: Wait until a drone is available in the underground.
Translation: 等待直到地下有1架无人机可用。
可能的无底深坑研究地点

Text:
A new experiment protocol has been drafted to put an end to the debate on the existence of a bottom to the Pit! This time, the engineers want to gather data by “deploying” a device packed with sensors and lights. They reckon a drone is a perfect fit for the job.

Should we let them continue with their plans?

Text: Double cordon off the pit while we are waiting for the Bottomless Pit Lab.

Text: 1 drone was thrown in The Pit

Text: The Pit: It worked, until it didn't

The drone’s sensors and light proved to be effective, until the drone reached minus three kilometers. Many hypotheses were raised: electromagnetic perturbation, temperature, atmospheric pressure. One thing is sure, we still have not heard any sound coming from the pit and the hypothesis of it being bottomless is gaining traction. 

We have picked up chatter among the engineers that they believe the drone just was not resilient enough. It seems they are already plotting their next experiment…

<effect> Gain <research(reg_param1)> Research
Translation:
无人机的传感器和灯光一开始很好用，直到无人机下到三千米深度。人们提出了种种假设：电磁干扰、温度、大气压等等。有一点是肯定的，我们仍然没有听到坑里传来任何声音，关于它是无底洞的假说越来越受到关注。

我们听到工程师们的交谈，他们认为无人机的适应力不足。看起来他们已经在计划下一次的实验了……

Text: Dropping a drone down was more of a "success" until it wasn't. There's already talk about a new, improved plan.
Translation: 往里面丢无人机一开始还算“成功”，但好景不长。已经有人在谈论更好的新方案了。

Text:
Our engineers are convinced they have the ultimate experiment to put an end to our questions. They want to “deploy” something more robust, containing more sensors and heavier than the previous test payload. The calculations are clear, the new subject needs to be roughly the size, the weight and as robust as a rover. 

If only we had something like that to conduct our final experiment with...
Translation:
我们的工程师们确信，他们能搬出最终实验来结束我们的质疑。他们想“布署”更耐用、容纳的传感器更多，且重量超过之前测试负载的东西。计算结果很明确，新的实验体大约在尺寸、重量和耐用程度上和探测车相当。

我们要是有那种东西来进行最终实验就好了……

Text: In for a penny in for a rover! (lose 1 RC Explorer).
Translation: 一不做二不休，不就一辆探测车嘛！（失去1辆遥控探索者）。

Text: Triple cordon off the pit while we are waiting for the Bottomless Pit Lab.
Translation: 我们在等待无底深坑实验室的同时第三次封锁深坑。

Text: 1 RC Explorer was thrown in The Pit
Translation: 一台遥控探索者被扔进了深坑

Text:
Today’s results exceed all our prior hypotheses! Unfortunately, we lost contact with the rover five kilometers into the pit. No sound has been recorded as of yet. The pit has been unofficially dubbed “The Bottomless Pit” by the research team. 

All our engineers now agree that a Bottomless Pit Lab needs to be build. We will use whatever means to get to the bottom of this mystery!

<effect> Gain <research(reg_param1)> Research
Translation:
今天的结果超过了我们之前所有的假设！很不幸，在探测车下到深坑五千米处时，我们和它失去了联系。至今为止，还没有记录到任何声音。这个坑被研究团队戏称为“无底深坑”。

现在，我们所有的工程师一致认为有必要建造一座无底深坑实验室。我们会用尽一切办法解开这个谜团！

<effect>获得<research(reg_param1)>研究点数
